result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph D Wentz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joseph D Wentz is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Joseph D Wentz was found guilty of Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Transfer of probation authorized to IL.

miscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.

$250 DNA surcharge remitted. $268  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Maintain full-time employment/education or combination of or be seeking same, and treatment.  Obtain GED or high school diploma or equivalency.

Curfew allowed 1 hr before and after work.  Random UA & BA testing at discretion of agent.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

Information was filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defn waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of not guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued
Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing signed.

Defn wants an Atty.  COURT: advises him to go to SPD now if he wants to apply for their counsel, and return with an answer on whether he qualifies.  

Defn returns and does qualify, court will reset.
Preliminary hearing on August 11, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.  
- Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.

Trial judge - Br 2

Defendant appeared.  Mauricio Cardona appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
